data.text: The Most Durable Tent for Bicycle Touring?
What‚Äôs the best most durable tent for bicycle touring

I have a 7 years old hilleberg nammatji with around 4 years of every day use, apart from the main zip sliders and the waterproofing of the floor, its still doing great, the downside is only the weight but its still ok if carried on a bike
data.author: Giacomo Venturelli

data.text: how heavy and how many person?
data.author: Dan Hurley

data.text: 3 persons, about 4 kg
data.author: Giacomo Venturelli

data.text: Giacomo and - Hilleberg makes the best tents ‚õ∫Ô∏è. We spent 25 months (2013-2015) in their Nallo 3 GT and now we‚Äôre using their Nammatj 3 GT as we make our way south from Deadhorse, Alaska. Currently in Honduras üá≠üá≥üòÄ! Also own their Akto and Anjan
data.author: Ron Bennett

data.text: and yeah the weight of the Nammatj is noticeable but it‚Äôs a solid home away from home! During our first tour we too had to replace the zipper sliders and stitch up one of the stake hold downs (hope that makes sense) but otherwise our Nallo is still solid after hundreds of nights in it! Good luck!
data.author: Ron Bennett

data.text: wow the gt version are beasts üòÑ and like the others are ideal for tropical weather too, we are in Panama at the moment, every night sauna till 3 am ü§£

data.text: not sure how you are able to sleep in the tent in this heat! It‚Äôs been a week since we‚Äôve slept in ours back on the beach in El Salvador and despite having a nice breeze it was as you put it, a sauna.

data.author: Ron Bennett

data.text:
I use this tent. Heavy at 8 lbs., yes, but I lost 10 lbs. off of my body to compensate for it. My camping would be considered overly comfy by most serious bikepackers and tourers. The point really is though that the same company makes 1, 2 and 3 person tents in this line too, and they are very nice and quite durable, and the price is also nice. The aluminum poles are a good diameter and the #8 zippers are sturdy. https://smile.amazon.com/ALPS-Mountaineering-Lynx-4-Person-Tent/dp/B00B7N6R0Q/ref=sr_1_3?crid=2E92HUBGOSYH0&keywords=alps+mountaineering+tents&qid=1648778962&sprefix=alps+m%2Caps%2C416&sr=8-3
ALPS Mountaineering Lynx 4-Person Tent
amazon.com
data.author: Diane Farley

data.text: I bought a three man tent for my travels because it seems that the one and two man tents are made for people under 61" in length. I want room to put stuff.
data.author: Bob Loblawb

data.text: I have a double sleep pad & bag, and there is enough room for a small table and all of my panniers. I‚Äôm too old to rough it anymore. ü•¥
data.author: Diane Farley

data.text: I‚Äôve been using a Big Agnes Fly Creek UL1 since 2011. I‚Äôve used it for several weeks long tours, short tours, and overnight backpacking trips. It‚Äôs a light, tough tent.
data.author: Stuart Black

data.text: I switched from pretty good Alps mountaineering Chaos 8 lbs tent to a Big Agnes copper spur at 3 lbs, trying to shave weight the chaos was good, I'm sure the Agnes will be too
data.author: Dennis Peterson

data.text: Hilleberg
data.author: Tom Heutte

data.text: As I go about 2 weeks per year bikepacking,I don't want to spend big money on my equipment. My tent Comes from Decathlon; a little 2pers. dome; ‚Ç¨25. Actually,I don'thave big money to spend! And....I thoroughly enjoy my trips that way.
data.author: Greet Ellen

data.text: I use a Fjallraven abisko lite 2 weighs 1.7kg and packs down small to fit in one of my rear panniers with room to spare for clothing.
data.author: Tim Swain

data.text: I use a OEX Phoxx 2 from Go Outdoors. Comes in at 2.1kg but large enough to sleep in with plenty of room to bring all the pannier bags in for the night. Also has 5.5m of waterproofing so can withstand most UK downpours without leaking.
data.author: Alan Prior

data.text: Naturehike VIK 2
data.author: Thom McAdams

data.text: Don't know, I got the cheapest 40 buck 4 man Coleman tent and even though it's 8 years old and only fits 2, I'm too cheap to replace with a better one.
data.author: Gordo S. Groundchuck
Peter Loo
Peter Loo

data.text: Lightwave tents worth looking at. I‚Äôve just bought one to replace my 35 year old Fjallraven. I wanted a bit more space. I‚Äôve not tested in the rain yet. Hilleburg are very good but also very pricey.
data.author: Tony Jackson

data.text: Had my Terra Nova Photon 2 person tent for about 8 years now, still in perfect condition. I've heard they are a bit hard to come by, but if you see one you can't go wrong.
data.author: Jessica Kittle

data.text: My big Agnes Copper Spur UL2 has been through storms, crashes, mountaintops, bogs, you name it and shined through it all. Definitely get the groundcloth!
data.author: David Miller

data.text: Love my Nemo Hornet 2p. Lightweight and survived a hurricane ü§î
